title: Kerala Cabinet approves ₹17 lakh for nurse remaining in coma after contracting Nipah
content: Cabinet approves pay hike for district government pleaders, public prosecutors, additional government pleaders and additional public prosecutors

title: Attend to transmission & land issues for achieving target of 500 GW RE generation, industry urges governments
content: ‘Renewable energy projects are suffering as governments have moved away from land responsibility’ say industry captains

title: Babulal Marandi demands judicial probe into alleged encounter killing of Surya Hansda in Jharkhand
content: The Leader of the Opposition in the Jharkhand Assembly referred to Hansda as a ‘public welfare activist’; Hansda contested Assembly elections on tickets from different political parties, including the BJP, and was wanted in several criminal cases

title: Farmers’ forum protest against Trump, seeks ban on corporates in agriculture
content: Protesters demand rollback of U.S. tariffs, scrapping of FTAs, repeal of labour codes, and protection of MSP

title: Red alert for South Coastal Andhra Pradesh as heavy rains set to continue
content: Mangalagiri records 19 cm of rainfall; low-pressure system over the Bay of Bengal likely to intensify, bringing extremely heavy rain to several districts on August 14

title: Two senior Maoists killed in Chhattisgarh
content: Vijay Reddy and Lokesh Salame were killed in an anti-Maoist operation conducted along the Banda Pahad hill under the Madanwada police station area

title: Man convicted of raping blind minor girl imprisoned for life
content: Jharsuguda district police secure conviction within 100 days of registration of case; the court also awarded compensation of ₹10,50,000 to the victim under the National Legal Services Authority’s  Compensation Scheme

title: Priyank flags more cases of ‘vote theft’
content: Wedding cards and hall tickets were used as address proof to register voters in Mahadevapura Assembly constituency, he alleged

title: State amended nine varsities’ laws to bypass binding UGC regulations: T.N. Governor
content: Governor, UGC on the same page in SC as petitioner-advocate Venkatachalapathy on the issue of legality of nine amended State Acts

title: Bill tabled to give more clarity on functioning of Greater Bengaluru Authority
content: It proposes to empower the GBA to make appointments of Group A (junior level) and Group B officers in accordance with the common cadre and recruitment rules

title: Villupuram Collector holds meeting with organisers of Vinayaka Chathurthi festival
content: The organisers have been instructed not to install statues measuring over 10 foot from the ground level, to obtain NOCs from tahsildars, lands owners. Only clay idols with water soluble paints are allowed, says Collector

title: Grand Sri Krishna Janmashtami celebrations planned at ISKCON Temple in Hubballi
content: Various rituals and programmes have been scheduled as part of the celebrations for three days starting tomorrow

title: Karnataka Agri Minister says urea shortage is a national problem
content: Stating that there was short-supply of urea from Centre, Karnataka Agriculture Minister alleges that just when the state was trying to convince farmers to switch over to alternatives like Nano urea, the Opposition parties had put the farmers in panic mode

title: Nearly 25 lakh people affected due to flood in 10 districts of Bihar
content: Chief Minister Nitish Kumar held a review meeting and asked the official concerned to remain alert on rising water level and provide all possible help to the affected people

title: Number of undocumented migrants voluntarily leaving India across border with Bangladesh tripled in 2025 compared to 2024, government data show
content: An official said that post the political changes in Bangladesh on August 5, 2024, there has been a surge in the number of undocumented migrants leaving India voluntarily

title: India to mark 79th Independence Day with the theme of ‘Naya Bharat’
content: Bands of defence and paramilitary forces will perform for the first time on the evening of the Independence Day celebrations at over 140 prominent locations across the country

title: T.N. govt. holds meeting with exporters amid concerns over U.S. tariffs
content: Minister for Industries T.R.B. Rajaa chairs meeting. Later, in a social media post, he said it was imperative to listen and understand the hurdles of exporters for a calibrated policy response

title: Every theatre must screen a Bengali film daily at prime time: State government
content: Bengali film industry professionals welcome the move; the Trinamool government is placing the spotlight onto the Bengali language amidst attacks on Bengali-speaking migrants in other States

title: Visakhapatnam girls excel in roller skating, sharing their inspiring journey to success
content: Visakhapatnam skaters D Greeshma and Sivakoti Kshetra relive their journey to gold and silver at the Asian Roller Skating Championship, opening up about the training and passion that fuelled their success

title: MHA approves first ever cadre review of BSF personnel
content: Spanning from Constable to Inspector, the implementation has already commenced, and will cover immediate promotions for 23,710 personnel

title: Rahul to lead 16-day ‘Vote Adhikar Yatra’ in Bihar as Congress intensifies fight against SIR
content: Yatra will pass through many areas where residents have complained of deletion of names in the SIR exercise; Congress to hold rallies in all States between August 22 and September 7

title: Jaishankar to visit Moscow; Wang Yi to be in New Delhi
content: India to step up engagements with China and Russia; move come amid uncertainty in trade ties with U.S. after it imposed high tariffs; China likely to continue border talks during its Foreign Minister’s visit

title: QFI-Chennai to host quiz competitions on August 16 and 17
content: ‘QFIesta’ will be held at the Music Academy Mini Hall, and is open to everyone. Each team can have a maximum of three members, and can register for the event the venue

title: 82% human-street dog encounters in India 'peaceful', research finds amid Supreme Court order
content: Reported human rabies cases in India have fallen by nearly 75% over the past two decades, from 274 in 2005 to 34 in 2022, largely due to mass dog vaccination and improved post-exposure prophylaxis

title: SC agrees to constitute search committee for V-Cs’ appointments  in APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University and Digital University Kerala
content: It asks the State and the Governor to provide, by August 14, four names each for inclusion on the five-member search panel. The court will select four names for the search committee from both lists. The fifth member of the search committee would be nominated by the University Grants Commission

title: Non-classified hotels seek 3-star licence fee relief in Andhra Pradesh
content: Delegation urges government to extend lower fee, relax rules for high-standard hotels outside star classification

title: HC modifies order, says  washrooms in fuel outlets should remain open to public round the clock
content: The court had in June issued an interim order stating that the government cannot insist that toilets in private petroleum retail outlets be allowed for use by members of the public

title: Gallantry medals for Operation Sindoor to be announced on Independence Day
content: Operation Sindoor’s success will be celebrated at this year’s Independence Day festivities, themed around the ‘continuing rise of a prosperous, secure and bold Naya Bharat’

title: Joint selection of Nandi Awards by Andhra Pradesh and Telangana opposed
content: Film director Dileep Raja says award process should reflect A.P.’s identity and be based purely on merit

title: One held for defrauding students
content: Jinto Joy is accused of duping higher education aspirants in the name of an educational consultancy after guaranteeing them admissions at various colleges

title: Road accidents claim 60,115 lives in five-and-a-half years in Karnataka
content: Bengaluru city reported the highest number of accidents, 21,910, resulting in 4,154 deaths and injuries to 16,247 people, says Minister

title: Rahul Gandhi vs EC: The need to address electoral roll mess in Bengaluru
content: We speak to Kathyayini Chamaraj, Executive Trustee, CIVIC Bangalore about the need to address electoral roll mess in Bengaluru.

title: Tenant farmers urge banks to sanction crop loans without discrimination
content: AIKS-led delegation seeks equal access to credit for recognition card holders, calls for mandal-level meetings to address loan grievances

title: Over ₹107 crore credited to 1.6 lakh farmers in Eluru district under Annadata Sukhibhava, says Minister
content: Minister assures swift resolution of pending cases, urges beneficiaries to approach agriculture officers for assistance

title: SI comes under police scrutiny for ‘obscene’ video calls
content: The incident, which is said to have happened few months ago, came to light after a video of it went viral on social media

title: Karnataka rolls out measures to enforce plastic ban in temples from August 15
content: In the first phase, 25 temples have been selected for the installation of solid and liquid waste management units: Muzrai  Minister

title: Cutting the slope for road widening works on NH a main reason for recent landslips, says study
content: The expert team held a drone inspection on the spot and is ready to submit a detailed report of the study if the district administration asks for it

title: Parties trade charges as bogus voter row escalates in Thrissur
content: Dual voter ID claims, cross-district transfers and calls for judicial probe intensify political storm

title: Police stops farmers rally in Ongole district
content: Leaders of Samyukta Kisan Morcha and United Front of Trade Unions warn the government that they will have to face the public anger if it tries to suppress protests with force

title: ED searches residence of MLA Satish Sail
content: A team led by six officials conducted searches in the residence of Congress MLA Satish Sail at Sadashivgad near Karwar throughout the day

title: Farmers, workers protest FTAs, warn of corporate takeover of agriculture
content: Unions allege India–U.S. trade pacts threaten farming, aquaculture, and rural livelihoods; demand MSP for all crops, tariff rollbacks, and reversal of labour laws

title: Karnataka to provide life jackets for fishermen
content: Two ‘sea ambulances’ will be operational within two months for emergency treatment, says Minister Vaidya

title: Book highlights ‘disparities’ in Kerala’s education sector
content: Of the 150 uneconomic higher secondary batches in the State, which have less than 25 students, 106 are in the southern districts, says the book

title: Bihar SIR is a battle between EC’s power over polls and citizens’ right to vote: SC
content: Unlawful procedures in hasty SIR process is a “casual way of doing away with citizens’ right to vote”, say petitioners; judge says EC has some “elbow room” for special revision, but only in exceptional circumstances

title: Karnataka recorded 1,799 child marriages in 3 years: Minister
content: Child marriages were the major reason for the increasing number of underage pregnancies in the State, Hebbalkar states

title: Over 3 lakh apply for inclusion in voters’ list in Kozhikode
content: Kozhikode ranks second in the State for the highest number of applicants, while Malappuram, with 4,14,953 applicants, tops the list

title: Protest in Kalaburagi seeking action against those maligning Dharmasthala’s name
content: ‘Since the Congress government has come to power, the State has witnessed a series of such disturbing incidents,’ says the former Sedam MLA Rajkumar Patil Telkur

title: RySS to bring 3.5 lakh farmers in Andhra Pradesh under natural farming this year: official
content: Training for Bio-Resource Centre owners focuses on organic inputs, intercropping models, and long-term soil health benefits

title: Tourists from T.N. injured as minibus overturns in Idukki
content: Accident at Vattakkannippara, near Rajakkad. Vehicle falls into roadside ditch after driver loses control

title: Dharmasthala Bhaktabhimani Vedike takes out protest march in Belagavi, Vijayapura
content: They raise slogans against those vested interests trying to defame Dharmasthala, its Dharmadhikari and his family

title: A.P. CM calls for urgent flood precautions in view of heavy rain
content: Emphasising efficient use of the heavy inflows, Naidu orders diversion of up to four tmc ft of floodwater daily to Somasila and Kandaleru reservoirs

title: Nipah survivor from Mangaluru in coma at Kozhikode hospital to get ₹17 lakh from CMDRF
content: He had initially contracted the infection while attending to a patient during the 2023 outbreak in Kozhikode

title: Don’t burden consumers with tariff hike, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs power utilities in Andhra Pradesh
content: Alternatively, the Chief Minister wants officials to tap potential of non-tariff revenue streams such as leasing AP-Transco’s fiber optic network to generate ₹7,000 crore; he also calls for reduction in power purchases from the open market and bringing down T&D losses

title: Mega protest in Hubballi on Sunday against efforts to defame Dharmasthala
content: They condemn defamation campaign by some vested interests against Dharmashthala and Dharmadhikari D. Veerendra Heggade

title: Stormwater master plan to be prepared for Telangana Core Urban Region
content: While the stormwater drains within GHMC have been enumerated multiple times through various consultants, the TCUR has not been included in the mapping

title: Bronze statues of 18th century warrior brothers of T.N. inaugurated in Chittoor
content: Brothers Periya Marudhu and Chinna Marudhu are revered as the first freedom fighters who waged a battle against the British East India Company

title: 'Useful idiot': Inside China’s long game - How Xi is squeezing Trump over trade
content: President Trump extended the US-China tariff truce for 90 days, aiming to de-escalate tensions. Xi Jinping is strategically weaponizing China's control over key supply chains, like rare earths, to exert economic pressure on the US and its allies. This approach allows China to target critical industries and defense sectors, potentially reshaping global trade dynamics.

title: SIR row: Rahul's high tea with 'dead people'; SC says electoral rolls bound for revision - top developments
content: The opposition has been protesting in both Houses of Parliament against the revision of electoral rolls, alleging that the EC's exercise is aimed at "disenfranchising voters" in Bihar ahead of the assembly elections due later this year. They have been demanding a discussion on the issue in both Houses. The ECI published the draft voter list on August 1.

title: Trump warns Putin of 'very severe consequences' if Ukraine war continues
content: President Trump warned Putin of severe consequences if the Ukraine war doesn't halt after their Alaska summit. This followed a virtual meeting where Zelenskyy downplayed Putin's military strength and the impact of sanctions, urging a ceasefire. European leaders, backing Zelenskyy, emphasised the need to protect their security interests, while Trump hinted at potential land swaps, a proposal Ukraine firmly rejects.

title: Perplexity, itself valued at $18 billion, offers $34.5 billion for Google Chrome
content: Perplexity, an AI search startup, has made a bold $34.5 billion all-cash offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser, aiming to challenge Google's search dominance. This move comes as Google faces antitrust pressure to divest Chrome. Perplexity pledges significant investment in Chrome's development and open-source nature, while maintaining user choice and continuity.

title: Oil, crypto or rare earths? What's behind Trump's new-found love for Pakistan - decoded
content: Donald Trump's growing relationship with Pakistan is causing concern in India. This includes crypto deals, oil shipments, and rare earth cooperation. It happens amid India-Pakistan tensions and a larger US role in the region. Pakistan will receive its first US crude oil shipment. A crypto firm linked to Trump has also signed a deal with Pakistan.

title: Virat Kohli drops major hint at ODI comeback ahead of Australia series
content: Virat Kohli is preparing for the upcoming Australia ODI series in October, following the postponement of the Bangladesh ODIs. He was recently seen training with Naeem Amin, hinting at his readiness for international cricket. While the BCCI is mindful of Kohli and Rohit Sharma's age, their experience and record in ODIs remain invaluable for India.

title: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke: There is no world where I would allow employees to say... ...
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: Savarkar case: Rahul disowns 'threat to life' plea; Cong says lawyer 'acted without consent'
content: Rahul Gandhi's lawyer filed a statement in a Pune court citing a threat to his life in a defamation case related to remarks against Savarkar, without Gandhi's consent. Gandhi strongly disagreed with the statement, prompting his lawyer to withdraw the application. The complainant, Satyaki Savarkar, alleges Gandhi falsely claimed V.D.

title: 'I hate this sooo much': Rishabh Pant shares injury struggle on social media
content: Rishabh Pant, sidelined with a toe fracture sustained during the England series, expressed his frustration on social media. However, the injured cricketer is finding ways to keep his spirits up. Pant shared a video of himself playfully baking pizzas, showcasing his culinary skills while recovering. Despite his uncertain return date, Pant's lighthearted approach to recovery is evident.

title: Pic | 'Buggi night': Zaheer's post with Rohit, Yuvraj coincides with LSG shake-up
content: Zaheer Khan's Instagram post featuring Rohit Sharma and Yuvraj Singh sparked nostalgia among fans, highlighting their enduring camaraderie. Rohit recently achieved the No. 2 spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings, while Zaheer is reportedly parting ways with the Lucknow Super Giants ahead of IPL 2026, as the franchise plans organisational changes.

title: Audi employees in Germany to the company: Cannot build a factory in America without ...
content: Audi's plan to establish a U.S. plant faces hurdles as labor leaders prioritize securing German jobs amidst President Trump's tariffs. The labor official, Jörg Schlagbauer, insists on long-term guarantees for German production before supporting U.S. expansion. Trump's tariffs, impacting European carmakers, prompt Audi to consider U.S.

title: 'Kicked me in stomach, hit me above eye': Another Indian assaulted in Ireland by teens
content: An Indian national in Dublin was recently assaulted by a group of teenagers in Fairview Park, prompting him to return to India. The victim recounted being kicked and beaten, with bystanders failing to intervene until two teenagers aided him and alerted the police.

title: Minimum balance row: ICICI bank withdraws Rs 50,000 rule; check details here
content: ICICI Bank faced widespread criticism after announcing a significant increase in minimum balance requirements for new account holders. Consequently, the bank rolled back the decision and revised its MAB norms to Rs 15,000 for metro and urban locations, Rs 7,500 for semi-urban, and Rs 2,500 for rural areas.

title: ‘Don't think US tariffs will…’: S&P confident Trump’s tariffs won’t impact India’s growth
content: S&P Global Ratings Director YeeFarn Phua has said that Trump's tariffs are unlikely to significantly impact India's economic growth due to its non-trade-oriented nature, with exports to the US representing only about 2% of GDP. Despite increased tariffs on Indian imports, S&P maintains a positive outlook on India's sovereign rating, projecting a GDP growth of 6.5%.

title: Wilson's wife Ciara first descendant of enslaved Africans to get Benin citizenship under new law
content: Ciara, the Grammy-winning singer, has made history by becoming one of the first to receive Beninese citizenship through a program aimed at reconnecting descendants of enslaved Africans. This initiative seeks to heal historical wounds and strengthen ties with the Black diaspora. Benin's efforts carry significant weight due to its role in the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Anthony Edwards: Faces $500K demand; Ayesha Howard speaks out; heated custody battle intensifies
content: NBA player Anthony Edwards is facing a legal battle with his former girlfriend, Ayesha Howard. Howard is seeking $500,000 and a public apology. This stems from a custody dispute over their daughter. Howard claims financial and reputational damage. She alleges Edwards made false statements. The case involves disagreements over custody arrangements and social media use.

title: Brock Lesnar 2025: Net worth revealed; WWE salary, contract details; big return & match ahead
content: Brock Lesnar, a dominant force in WWE and UFC, has returned to WWE at SummerSlam 2025 after a hiatus. Despite his absence since 2023, his net worth remains at $20 million, supplemented by endorsements and a $5 million WWE salary. Lesnar's contract remains active, and he is expected to face John Cena in Australia, potentially marking Cena's retirement match.

title: Eating almond with skin causes inflammation? Here's what a doctor says
content: Almonds, a nutritional powerhouse, contain lectins in their skins, prompting questions about their impact. While some experts suggest soaking, peeling, or roasting to reduce lectin levels and potential inflammation, Harvard nutritionists highlight that lectin-rich foods are linked to lower chronic disease rates. For most individuals, raw almonds, including their skins, are safe and beneficial, offering antioxidants and fiber.

title: SC order on Delhi stray dogs: CJI refers matter to 3-judge bench; hearing tomorrow
content: On August 11, a bench of Justices Pardiwala and R Mahadevan took a stern view of the stray dog menace and ordered the Delhi-NCR to start removing stray dogs from all localities within eight weeks and house them in dedicated dog shelters to be set up by civic authorities.​​​

title: Asia Cup | Shubman Gill - BCCI's new poster boy should lead India in T20Is too
content: With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma all but retired, the BCCI’s search for a new on-field leader and marketable face has turned to Shubman Gill. Already India’s Test captain, his growing brand value, T20I record, and leadership credentials make him a strong contender for the white-ball captaincy as well.

title: 'War 2' advance box office report: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR film earns Rs 16 crore
content: The highly anticipated 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, faces stiff competition from Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' which boasts impressive advance bookings. 'War 2' has gained momentum with strong Telugu market openings, surpassing ₹10 crore in Hindi version pre-sales. While 'Coolie' leads with a ₹75 crore worldwide gross, 'War 2' shows promising advance sales, exceeding recent big titles.

title: US Open: Venus Williams becomes oldest singles entrant in 44 years
content: Multiple Grand Slam champion Venus Williams, at 45, received a US Open singles wild card, marking her return to Grand Slam tennis and becoming the oldest entrant in 44 years. After overcoming health challenges and a lengthy absence, Williams aimed to make an impact, having last played singles at the event in 2023.

title: ‘Reprehensible act’: Indian temple in US vandalised; consulate seeks probe
content: The BAPS Swaminarayan Temple in Greenwood, Indiana, was vandalized, drawing strong condemnation from the Indian Consulate in Chicago, who have urged law enforcement to take swift action. This incident follows a similar act of vandalism at a BAPS temple in Chino Hills, California, less than six months ago.

title: America’s immigration rules are redefining ‘law’ for international students
content: At the 2025 EducationUSA Fair, U.S. Consul General Laura Williams warned of zero tolerance for law-breaking by students. New U.S. immigration rules broaden “law” to include social media activity, old misdemeanors, and political speech, leading to rising visa revocations and SEVIS terminations. Critics say these measures threaten academic freedom and silence international student activism.

title: Watch: Rohit Sharma's dance moves with wife go viral amid ODI ranking surge
content: Rohit Sharma, India's ODI captain, is trending due to a viral video showcasing his dance moves with wife Ritika Sajdeh at her brother's wedding in 2023. Despite being on a break after the 2025 IPL season, Rohit has climbed to No. 2 in the ICC ODI rankings, surpassing Babar Azam.

title: KBC17 promo: Women officers share courageous stories from Op Sindoor
content: Kaun Banega Crorepati 17's Independence Day special will feature three inspiring women officers: Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, and Commander Prerna Deosthalee. A promo reveals their experiences from Operation Sindoor, highlighting the importance of responding to Pakistan's actions. The episode, airing August 15th, has generated excitement, with viewers eager to witness the officers' courage and insights.

title: Gabrielle Union: ‘My happy place’; shows love for art; recent vineyard outing vibes
content: Gabrielle Union recently shared highlights from her Martha's Vineyard trip on Instagram, including a visit to an art gallery where she expressed her love for art. The trip coincided with a promotional event for Intuition by Aramis, a fragrance for which her husband, Dwyane Wade, serves as the global ambassador.

title: Monica Seles: Myasthenia Gravis diagnosis; champion’s battle; autoimmune disease fight
content: Tennis legend Monica Seles, a nine-time Grand Slam champion, reveals her three-year battle with myasthenia gravis (MG), a rare neuromuscular disease. At 51, Seles is speaking out to raise awareness, partnering with Argenx for the 'Go for Greater' campaign timed with the U.S. Open.

title: 'If they are saying so much to Sachin …': When Dravid took a cheeky dig at crowd criticism
content: RP Singh recently shared a humorous anecdote from 1999, revealing Rahul Dravid's witty side. During a Ranji Trophy match where Dravid scored 199, they watched Sachin Tendulkar bat in an India match. Tendulkar's run-a-ball innings prompted some criticism, leading Dravid to quip about the potential reactions to his own, more measured, batting approach.

title: 'I've lost Virat, Rohit, Dhoni's numbers': Ashwin shares 'scam' story
content: A man in Chhattisgarh unexpectedly received calls from cricket stars like Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers after purchasing a SIM card previously used by Rajat Patidar. This incident prompted Ravichandran Ashwin to share a story about a scammer impersonating Devon Conway, highlighting the importance of protecting personal information, especially for high-profile cricketers, in the digital age.

title: 'Unconstitutional, violates rights': Owaisi slams Hyderabad meat ban on Independence Day
content: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of AIMIM, has criticised the Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's order to close meat shops and slaughterhouses on Independence Day. Owaisi argues that the ban infringes upon citizens' rights to liberty, privacy, livelihood, culture, nutrition, and religion, questioning the connection between eating meat and celebrating independence.

title: 'No cricket tours to Pak ...': Govt outlines authority over India’s participation
content: India's National Sports Governance Bill, a landmark reform, is set for implementation within six months, according to Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. The bill establishes the National Sports Board and Tribunal, aiming for enhanced accountability. It grants the government power to restrict international participation in extraordinary circumstances, citing national security or global emergencies.

title: 'Anti-Tamil Nadu activities': Cong to boycott governor Ravi's Independence Day tea party
content: The Tamil Nadu Congress has announced a boycott of Governor R.N. Ravi's Independence Day tea party, citing his "anti-Tamil Nadu activities," including the rejection of a bill to establish a university named after former chief minister M Karunanidhi. The party also protests the Election Commission's voter list revision in Bihar.

title: Exclusive - Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah to finally welcome a new Rajasthani family
content: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah is set to introduce a new family to Gokuldham Society after 17 years, aiming to maintain its high entertainment value. Exclusive photos from the set reveal a Rajasthani family of four arriving on camels, hinting at a cultural twist.

title: Cong rallies behind Priyanka Gandhi, slams Israeli envoy’s ‘undiplomatic’ attack
content: Senior Congress leaders have strongly condemned Israeli Ambassador Reuven Azar's public criticism of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra regarding her statements on the Gaza situation. They described Azar's remarks as "unprecedented" and "intolerable," accusing him of a "brazen denial" of the humanitarian crisis.

title: ‘Coolie’ first review: Udhayanidhi Stalin hails Rajinikanth’s 50 years in cinema
content: Udhayanidhi Stalin congratulated Rajinikanth on his 50th year in film and praised 'Coolie' after a preview. He lauded the film as a power-packed entertainer, anticipating global success. Stalin extended wishes to the cast and crew, including Nagarjuna, Sathyaraj, Aamir Khan, and Shruti Haasan, heightening anticipation for the film's release in over 100 countries.

title: Browns QB Sanders injures oblique, skips practice
content: Browns rookie QB Shedeur Sanders injured an oblique throwing Wednesday morning, according to the team, and was held out of the first day of joint practices with the Eagles.

title: Sources: Blazers find buyer, will stay in Portland
content: Tom Dundon, owner of the NHL's Hurricanes, has agreed to buy the NBA's Trail Blazers for more than $4 billion and keep the team in Portland, sources told ESPN.

title: Cowboys' Jones: Experimental drug saved my life
content: Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones said in an interview that he dealt with stage 4 melanoma and an experimental trial drug saved his life.

title: Falcons' Penix involved in practice fight vs. Titans
content: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. was involved in a scuffle with the Titans during a joint practice Wednesday.

title: Porter Jr.: Betting impact 'going to get worse'
content: Michael Porter Jr., whose brother Jontay was banned from the NBA in 2024 for his role in a gambling scheme, says the expansion of sports betting has detracted from the integrity and enjoyment of the game "and it's only going to get worse."

title: NASCAR won't curb celebrations after Zilisch fall
content: NASCAR says it has no plans to limit driver celebrations in the aftermath of Xfinity driver Connor Zilisch's fall in Victory Lane and subsequent broken collarbone.

title: Lamar pulls challenge of Aikman No. 8 trademark
content: After more than a year, two-time NFL MVP Lamar Jackson has withdrawn his challenge to Pro Football Hall of Fame quarterback Troy Aikman's use of the No. 8 in trademarks Aikman and his company filed for in 2024.

title: How Knicks fans deal with being on MSG's banned list
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: How worried should Mets, Yankees be? ESPN insiders break it down
content: Not long ago, both N.Y. teams seemed to be cruising toward October -- then things took a turn for the worse.

title: Predicting the best, worst scenarios for every NFL team: Who can surpass 10 wins this season?
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: After suffering a catastrophic injury, can UNC quarterback Max Johnson get his career back on track?
content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

title: Predicting 2025-26, from Premier League title race to most entertaining teams
content: The new season has arrived! Which teams will win silverware? Who is poised to surprise? We asked our writers to predict it all, then drop their boldest, spiciest take for the campaign.

title: Fantasy Marathon mock draft: 'Big 4' quarterbacks all go in Round 3
content: The annual event concluded with a 10-team mock, during which two tight ends were drafted before the first quarterback was taken.

title: Taylor Swift to join Travis Kelce on 'New Heights,' reveals new album
content: After a teaser post with a Taylor Swift-shaped silhouette fueled rumors, it was confirmed that the pop star will make her first appearance on the Kelce brothers' podcast.

title: 10 biggest WNBA games that will determine the 2025 playoff race
content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the Sept. 11 regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

title: 11 second-year players who could break out this season
content: These super sophomores could make a significant impact, including on the College Football Playoff race.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: How Jerry Jones' contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100M
content: What is going on in Dallas? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: Lurking concerns for top 10 NBA contenders for the 2025-26 season
content: These 10 NBA franchises have the best chance to capture the NBA title. What hurdles will they have to overcome to raise the Larry O'Brien Trophy?

title: LaLiga questions: Barcelona-Madrid title race; Mbappé vs. Yamal
content: The new LaLiga season is upon us! Will Barcelona and Real Madrid dominate? Will Atlético spoil the party? Will Mbappé or Yamal shine brightest?

title: Coach? Star? Captain? All gone. Leverkusen's rebuild is total
content: A year after wining the Bundesliga, Leverkusen are rebuilding without their genius coach and star players.

title: UConn offers stadium suite as part of fantasy football draft hosting package
content: At $75 per person, the Rentschler Field draft experience will get you a catered suite, locker room tour and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool agree deal with defender Leoni
content: Liverpool have verbally agreed to personal terms with Parma defender Giovanni Leoni. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 2025 NFL betting preview: Three picks to make on your favorite team
content: Will your team beat its projected win total? What props should you target? Here are three bets we like for every NFL team.

title: Teams we like to beat or fall short of projected win totals
content: Who will exceed projections and who will fall short? Our analysts offer their best bets on teams' win totals.

title: Russia Restricts WhatsApp, Telegram Calls, Says Need To Fight Criminality
content: Russia announced curbs on calls on the WhatsApp and Telegram messenger apps on Wednesday, saying that this was necessary to fight criminality, state media reported.

title: White House Reviews Smithsonian Museums for 'Divisive Narratives'
content: The Smithsonian Institution said Wednesday that it was reviewing a White House letter announcing a probe of content at several museums for "divisive or partisan narratives."

title: Flights From Hyderabad Cancelled, Diverted Due To Heavy Rains
content: Several flights to and from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport were cancelled or diverted on Wednesday due to unfavourable weather conditions, airport sources said.

title: "Matter Of Pride For North Karnataka": Union Minister Pralhad Joshi On New SEZ
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi has welcomed the central government's announcement that a proposal by Aequs Infra's Hubballi Durable Goods Cluster Pvt Ltd to set up a Special Economic Zone (SEZ) for electronic components has become a reality.

title: 62-Year-Old UP Woman 'Digitally Arrested' For Over 42 Hours
content: A 62-year-old woman who was "digitally arrested" by cyber fraudsters at her home for nearly 42 hours, was rescued by police on Wednesday.

title: Trump Warns Of "Severe Consequences" If Putin Continues Ukraine War After Summit
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday there will be "very severe consequences" if Russian President Vladimir Putin doesn't agree to stop the Ukraine war after Friday's summit.

title: "Electoral Rolls Can't Remain Static": Top Court On Bihar SIR Row
content: The Supreme Court said electoral rolls cannot "remain static" and were bound to be revised as it disagreed with the submission that special intensive revision (SIR) of voter list in poll-bound Bihar had no basis in law and ought to be quashed

title: They Lack 'Expertise' In Handling India: Expert On US' Op Sindoor Response
content: The way the US treated India at the end of Operation Sindoor shows a lack of expertise on their part in terms of understanding how to act towards India, Max Abrahms, an international security professor and author on terrorist dynamics said.

title: 5 Get Life Imprisonment For 2012 Ethnic Violence In Bodoland
content: Five people have been sentenced to life imprisonment by the Special Designated Court of the CBI, Bongaigaon, in a case related to the 2012 ethnic conflict in Bodoland Territorial Areas District.

title: Assam Congress To Train 29,000 Booth Agents To Check Against Voter List Manipulation
content: As opposition parties continue their protests against the revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, called the Special Intensive Revision (SIR), the Assam Congress is preparing a strategy to counter any voter list manipulation.

title: "Our Role Not To Echo Passions Of Moment": What Top Court Said In Dog Order
content: In its order on stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, the Supreme Court has said the judiciary bears the sole responsibility to "possess the courage and strength" to remind people of truths that they may not prefer to hear.

title: Delhi's Big Step To Clean Up Yamuna - A Rs 917-Crore Plan Approved
content: In a significant step toward cleaning the Yamuna, the Delhi Jal Board has approved projects worth Rs 917 crore to boost the capital's sewage treatment capacity by 51.5 million gallons per day.

title: CBI Arrests Bengal Man Accused Of Rape During Violence After 2021 Assembly Polls
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday said it has arrested a person, who had been absconding and was accused in a rape case related to violence after the West Bengal assembly polls in 2021.

title: US Responds To Chinese Collision, Deploys 2 Warships To South China Sea
content: The United States deployed two warships on Wednesday in a disputed South China Sea shoal, where two Chinese navy and coast guard ships collided two days ago while trying to drive away a smaller Philippine ship in a high-seas accident.

title: Wrong Climate Choices? Dog Ownership A Surprising Culprit: Study
content: It turns out many Americans aren't great at identifying which personal decisions contribute most to climate change.

title: Sale, Slaughter Of Meat Banned In Bengaluru On August 16
content: The BBMP on Wednesday announced a ban on animal slaughter and sale of meat in the city on August 16, marking the occasion of Krishna Janmashtami.

title: RBI Panel Proposes Fund To Build Homegrown AI Framework For Finance Sector
content: A Reserve Bank of India committee has recommended a framework for developing AI capabilities for the country's financial sector, while safeguarding it against associated risks, according to a report released on Wednesday.

title: DGCA Issues Warning To Air India, Seeks Stricter Compliance
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has issued a warning letter to Air India Ltd., cautioning the airline over violations of flight time regulations.

title: Influencer With 1.2 Million Instagram Followers Arrested In Rs 40-Crore Laundering Case
content: An 'entrepreneur' with over 1.2 million followers on Instagram, whose bio also states that she is an actor, has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a Rs 40-crore money laundering case.

title: 100 Stray Dogs Picked Up In 2 Days, Civic Body To Relocate Sick Canines First
content: The MCD has picked up 100 stray dogs so far since the Supreme Court order on relocating canines, and converted the city's 20 Animal Birth Control (ABC) centres into shelter homes, Mayor Raja Iqbal Singh said on Wednesday.

content: new: "Borz" isn't thinking about any of that, but right now, he's not thinking about anything . new: he is preparing lunch at the camp, but today's itinerary has been thrown . he will fight for a title on august 19 at 10 p.m. ET on PPV .

title: Twins no longer for sale; owners eye investors
content: the Minnesota Twins are no longer for sale, executive chair Joe Pohlad announces . the family will remain the principal owner of the club and add new investors instead . a banking magnate bought the Twins in 1984 for $44 million . "we have been fully open to all possibilities," he said .
